intro: Stillingia sylvatica, commonly known as Indian paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and罂粟. The plant is characterized by its striking red, orange, or yellow flowers that resemble paintbrushes. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in woodland areas. Stillingia sylvatica is known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various therapeutic purposes.
